title: Brayan Bello reflects on rough playoff start, enters Red Sox camp with new pitch
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Brayan Bello has introduced a curveball after ending last season with a 5.40 ERA over five September starts.
Bello aims to improve his 2026 performance after a short postseason outing against the Yankees in the Wild Card Series.
Bello is working with teammate Ranger Suarez on refining his curveball, enhancing his pitching repertoire for the upcoming season.

title: A popular Vermont ski resort is under new ownership
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Smugglers' Notch Resort in Jeffersonville, Vermont, has been acquired by Bear Den Partners.
Bill Stritzler, owner for 29 years, will retain a stake, and his daughter will serve as an advisor.
The acquisition emphasizes community involvement and plans to maintain the resort's focus on families.

title: Mass. senators push bill that could allow residents to sue ICE agents
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts senators propose bill allowing residents to sue federal officers for constitutional rights violations, including ICE agents.
The bill, part of the Senate's "Response 2025" initiative, targets excessive force amid criticisms of federal immigration policies.
The legislation, backed by several senators, allows lawsuits in state or federal court but preserves qualified immunity for officers.

title: Six arrested in Springfield drug and gun trafficking busts
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Six arrested in Springfield after coordinated operations against drug and gun trafficking by Massachusetts State Police.
Police seized 15 handguns, six rifles, 11 magazines, along with 8.5 kg of cocaine and 30,000 fentanyl bags.
Operations involved Massachusetts State Police, Springfield teams, and FBI, resulting in $63,000 cash seizure.

title: Dropkick Murphys cut ties with Wasserman agency after CEO’s name appears in Epstein files
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Dropkick Murphys cut ties with Wasserman agency over CEO Casey Wasserman's links to Epstein files.
Emails between Casey Wasserman and Ghislaine Maxwell from 2003 emerged in Department of Justice documents.
Wasserman remains chair of LA28 despite calls for his resignation after review of interactions with Epstein.

title: Video: Water pours into South Station from newly renovated ceiling
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A sprinkler line was damaged by a maintenance worker at South Station, causing water to fall into the concourse.
Hines Development, responsible for South Station Tower's construction, employed the contractor involved in the incident.
MBTA promptly isolated and resolved the issue without disrupting train services; cleanup concluded by Thursday evening.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge of recent Greater Boston stories.
Peter Chianca is the General Assignment Editor at Boston.com since 2019.
The quiz includes trending news topics from the Greater Boston area.

title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The MBTA Hingham/Hull ferry service is canceled on February 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will replace the ferry service, operating from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal starting at 6:30 a.m.
The recent snowstorm, depositing over a foot of snow, caused the unusually thick ice leading to the ferry's cancellation.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Retired Gloucester firefighter Daniel Kennedy died after being struck by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
Kennedy, a 60-year-old Desert Storm veteran, died at Lahey Hospital nearly a week after the February 5 incident.
An investigation by the Middlesex DA, Massachusetts State Police, and MSP Crash Analysis teams is ongoing.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas may start the 2026 season in Triple-A Worcester due to injury concerns and roster competition at first base.
Kristian Campbell likely begins in Worcester as the Red Sox evaluate defensive options and have DH role competition.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early might miss Opening Day roster due to experienced starters ahead in rotation.
